content.question: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. Nitrogen dioxide, <math alttext="N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, is produced as a by-product of the combustion of fossil fuels in internal combustion engines. At elevated temperatures <math alttext="N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> decomposes according to the equation below. <math alttext="2 N O 2, gas produces 2 N O, gas plus O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> The concentration of a sample of <math alttext="N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is monitored as it decomposes and is recorded on the graph directly below. The two graphs that follow it are derived from the original data. (a) Explain how the graphs indicate that the reaction is second order.

frqParts.text: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. Nitrogen dioxide, <math alttext="N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, is produced as a by-product of the combustion of fossil fuels in internal combustion engines. At elevated temperatures <math alttext="N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> decomposes according to the equation below. <math alttext="2 N O 2, gas produces 2 N O, gas plus O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> The concentration of a sample of <math alttext="N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is monitored as it decomposes and is recorded on the graph directly below. The two graphs that follow it are derived from the original data. (a) Explain how the graphs indicate that the reaction is second order.

(b) Write the rate law for the decomposition of <math alttext="N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Consider two possible mechanisms for the decomposition reaction. (i) Is the rate law described by mechanism I shown below consistent with the rate law you wrote in part (b) ? Justify your answer. Mechanism <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Step 1: N O 2, gas plus N O 2, gas, reacts to produce N O, gas plus N O 3, gas, slow. Step 2: N O 3, gas produces, N O, gas plus O 2, gas, fast." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mtext>Step</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>1:</mtext></mtd><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd><mtd><mi>s</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Step</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>2</mtext><mtext>:</mtext></mtd><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>s</mi><mi>t</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

(ii) Is the rate law described by mechanism <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> shown below consistent with the rate law you wrote in part (b) ? Justify your answer. Mechanism <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Step 1: N O 2, gas plus N O 2, gas, is in equilibrium with N 2 O 4, gas, fast equilibrium. Step 2: N 2 O 4, gas produces, 2 N O, gas plus O 2, gas, slow." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mtext>Step</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>1:</mtext></mtd><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>s</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>b</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>m</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Step</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>2</mtext><mtext>:</mtext></mtd><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd><mtd><mi>s</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
